input_sentence: At intersections and junctions, ego must yield to vehicles coming from right side of ego, provided there is no traffic sign number 306 in front of ego.

atomic_propositions.description: Other vehicle is on right side of ego
Sign 306 is in front of ego

temporal_relations.description: At intersection/junction with vehicle on right and no sign 306, ego must yield

lexicon.other_on_right: other vehicle is on right side of ego
lexicon.sign_in_front: traffic sign 306 is in front of ego

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Parse objects list to build ID→name mapping:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other  
   - obj_sign_306 → sign_306

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: at_intersection(ego) [unary predicate]
   - ap_2: at_junction(ego) [unary predicate]
   - ap_3: in_right_of(other,ego) [relational predicate with ego as related_object]
   - ap_4: yield(ego,other) [relational predicate with other as related_object]
   - ap_5: in_front_of(sign_306,ego) [relational predicate with ego as related_object]

3. Build the conditional structure from temporal_relations:
   - Antecedent: (at_intersection(ego) | at_junction(ego)) & in_right_of(other,ego) & ~in_front_of(sign_306,ego)
   - Consequent: yield(ego,other)

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator

Final MTL Formula:
G(((at_intersection(ego) | at_junction(ego)) & in_right_of(other,ego) & ~in_front_of(sign_306,ego)) -> yield(ego,other))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Parse objects list to build ID→name mapping:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other  
   - obj_sign_306 → sign_306

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: at_intersection(ego) [unary predicate]
   - ap_2: at_junction(ego) [unary predicate]
   - ap_3: in_right_of(other,ego) [relational predicate with ego as related_object]
   - ap_4: yield(ego,other) [relational predicate with other as related_object]
   - ap_5: in_front_of(sign_306,ego) [relational predicate with ego as related_object]

3. Build the conditional structure from temporal_relations:
   - Antecedent: (at_intersection(ego) | at_junction(ego)) & in_right_of(other,ego) & ~in_front_of(sign_306,ego)
   - Consequent: yield(ego,other)

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- The formula begins with the global operator `G`, indicating an "Always" condition that applies continuously over time.
- The antecedent (condition part) contains three conjuncts connected by `&`:
  1. `(at_intersection(ego) | at_junction(ego))` - This uses the unary predicates to state that the ego vehicle is either at an intersection or at a junction, translating to "ego is at an intersection or junction".
  2. `in_right_of(other,ego)` - This relational predicate means the other vehicle is positioned to the right of the ego vehicle, translated as "another vehicle is on the right side of ego".
  3. `~in_front_of(sign_306,ego)` - The negation of the relational predicate indicates that traffic sign 306 is not in front of the ego vehicle, so "traffic sign 306 is not in front of ego".
- The implication `->` leads to the consequent `yield(ego,other)`, a relational predicate meaning the ego vehicle yields to the other vehicle.
- All predicates explicitly reference their objects (ego, other, sign_306), preserving the specific entities involved in the scenario.

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if the ego vehicle is at an intersection or junction, another vehicle is on the right side of ego, and traffic sign 306 is not in front of ego, then the ego vehicle must yield to the other vehicle.

verification_result.back_translation: Always, if the ego vehicle is at an intersection or junction, another vehicle is on the right side of ego, and traffic sign 306 is not in front of ego, then the ego vehicle must yield to the other vehicle.

  3. `~in_front_of(sign_306,ego)` - The negation of the relational predicate indicates that traffic sign 306 is not in front of the ego vehicle, so "traffic sign 306 is not in front of ego".
- The implication `->` leads to the consequent `yield(ego,other)`, a relational predicate meaning the ego vehicle yields to the other vehicle.

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
synthesizer.description: Responsible for synthesizing syntactically correct MTL formulas from semantic components

verifier.name: Verifier_Agent
verifier.description: Responsible for verifying the semantic correctness of MTL formulas through back-translation
